history.text: hello
what did you think of the movie
I feel that this movie is cute and entertaining for both children and adults. What did you think of the movie?
i agree very entertaining
although it is a cartoon in a way it is relatable

I agree with you. 
I think that it shows that we can find unlikely friendships in those that we may not like at first and can find similarities in those that we feel we are different from.
yes so true
usually we meet people at first and not really get along but along the way, we end up being friends with them
Absolutely. I think this is a great way to teach children these lessons without them realizing it and it's a great way to remind adults of these lessons as well.
As adult we also learn that things dont always go as planned

we go to universities hoping and planning to study something and usually
 end up changing our major multiple times
That's absolutely true. I did so myself several times. I think it was a great idea to have this movie to be based in college for that very reason.

its like even monster don't
 have their life together
Lol that's a great way to put it. If monsters don't, why should we? Lol
also i think collage/universities are suppose to teach us more on life than school anyways
sometime its nice to have a friend who is better at things than we are.
I think so, too. This is the first time that most people have to decide things for themselves in terms of their futures and what they want to do with their lives.
yeah and collage opens up our eye to so many different opportunities

our dreams and goals might have been influenced
 by our environment thus when we change our environment, we grow as individuals and find our new ways which can cause us to change where we are headed
I can agree with that just from personal experiences.
The ratings on this movie were not very consistent. Which do you agree with?
In monster university we have two frenemies one is good at scaring and the other is good with books, if they could have helped each other they both would have been able to succeed instead of failing
i think it should have gotten a better rating
That is very true as well. They could have learned from one another and applied those lessons to their own lives.
I agree as well. I think the 65/100 and 6.8/10 were very harsh.
yeah specially since its better than most movies
would you watch a sequal
sequel*
I definitely would watch a sequel depending on what it is about.
maybe them trying to find a job
It would be nice to see them as adults with their own families and how life is treating them.
because God knows its hard to find a job. i want to see the take on that
yeah and a weeding will be nice too
A wedding would be so cute! That's a great idea!
i dont know i appreciate watching movies that actually have real life fee to them, even if they are animated
I do as well. It makes them more believable and tolerable to watch.
feel*
i totally agree
have you even watched any other movie by the same director
I cannot recall that I have. Have you?
i think he also directed cars
the animated movies
i watched that one
I have not seen that movie. Did you like it?
to be honest dont remember much
I suppose it did not leave much of an impression on you since you don't remember much.
i guess not
what kind of movies do you like to watch
I like to watch all types of movies but my favorites are animation, thriller, and romance.
What kinds do you like to watch?
i prefer tv shows but i like hallmark movies
the movies remind me of all the dance and cheerleading movies
What is your favorite Hallmark movie? What would you suggest?

with the way they enter the fraternity
  scare game and they become last first and then they end up winning
summer villa
naughty or nice
